issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Default value for maximum nodemanager connect wait time is too high

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.summary: default rm/am expire interval should not be smaller than default resourcemanager connect wait time

comments.body: I don't know why DEFAULT_RESOURCEMANAGER_CONNECT_MAX_WAIT_MS is 15min,  just set it to 10min, equals to default NM expire time

We need to be careful here. Clients from gateway machines should be treated separately from AMs - a distinction we don't have today. It actually makes sense for clients to retry for a longer time than is usual for AMs.
agree, we should set nm, am, client  separately
